ing: 1 (10 fluid ounce) bottle steak sauce (such as A1Â®)
1 (12 ounce) bottle tomato-based chili sauce (such as HeinzÂ®)
1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as TabascoÂ®), or to taste
des: "Henry Bain was a maitre d' at Louisville's all-male Pendennis Club in the early 20th century. This recipe was obtained through the current president of the club, a personal friend. The recipe yields 4 pints and may be quartered. Pour into pint jars for easy storage. This is a steak sauce. Some people add a small amount of bourbon whiskey."
ins: Mix chutney, pickled walnuts, ketchup, steak sauce, Worcestershire sauce, chili sauce, and hot pepper sauce in a large bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use. Serve at room temperature.
